item.description:
The Purgatory Brook Trail follows the scenic Purgatory Brook which along it's 3 mile stretch of trail has 3 different water falls (upper, middle, and lower). Although the ground is rough in places it's nothing that can't be relatively easily navigated by simply watching where you put your feet. Although not necessary hiking poles could help with that. As the trail follows the stream for people who only want to hike 3 miles one way we would have to have some cars parked at both ends of the trail. For people feeling up to doing a 6 mile hike we will simply be following the trail back to the starting point the same way after dropping off the people who only want to do 3 miles.

The section of brook we will be hiking on runs through the towns of Lyndeborough, Mont Vernon, and Milford. We will start near the lower falls and head upstream towards the upper falls.

There are a few spots where there are drop offs and you might want to keep your dogs away from them or on leash if they can't be trusted to stay away from them upon voice commands to do so.

The parking lot we will start at if coming from Route 101 is 0.8 miles along North River Road to Fitch's Corner where Purgatory Rd starts and then is another 0.4 miles on Purgatory Rd. and is on the left. There is a sign for both McLellan Trail and Purgatory Brook Trail there (see pictures). The actuall address I used is a house (duplex) just a bit past the parking lot (0.1 miles) on the right side of the road.

If you are coming from Mont Vernon on Purgatory Road you will continue on past the duplex another 0.1 mile and the parking lot will be on your right.

If you check out these links you can see pictures of where we will be going. It is a very scenic hike, so bring a camera if you would like to.

http://www.meetup.com/Manchester-Doggie-Paws/photos/644987/

 

http://www.meetup.com/Manchester-Doggie-Paws/photos/655225/

 

http://www.meetup.com/Manchester-Doggie-Paws/photos/655357/

Links to 2 trail maps:

http://www.nhmountainhiking.com/hike/purgatory/map_large.jpg

 

http://conservation.mont-vernon.nh.us/images/PurgatoryBase.jpg

Here is a link to a description of the upper falls.

http://conservation.mont-vernon.nh.us/purgfalls.html

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Purgatory Brook Trail - 3 Waterfalls 3 mile or 6 mile hike, your choice.
